Component.Description:
This component is aimed at running on-board on the wifibot and interfaces the RS232 serial protocol to control the wifibot.

Note that it is not compatible with the I2C wifibot protocol for older robot models.

Property.Description:
Defines the way this component receives left and right motors commands on its input(s):
  • Vectorized: the component will have only 1 input and expects on it a vector of 2 integers with the left and right motor speeds.
  • Left/Right separated: the component will have 2 inputs (left speed and right speed) and expects on each of them a scalar containing the required value for the corresponding motor.

Period (in microseconds) at which the motors commands are sent to the wifibot. If the wifibot does not receive commmands in a certain period of time, it just stops. So this component periodically repeats the last known commands in case no new command has arrived in the specified period.
Activates or not the PID controler for closed loop speed control on the wifibot.

Input.Description: To be connected to the output of the Serial port component.
